::Prowl::

Prowl frowns as Iron Raptor starts mewing, walking closer to her. 
Concern was written in his eyes, the Maximal forgetting about his own 
damage. He reaches out his good hand, trying to pat her on the head.

"Transform into robot mode, love, you should be allright then."



--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "Megan Solmonson" <tmrattrap@h...> wrote:
> 
> 
> * Cold black eyes watched Prowl as he fell backwards and landed 
hard on his 
> rear, seeing him express his pain as his damage becomes more 
noticable then 
> ever.
> But all she did was watch, simply see him.
> She followed his movements as he jumped to his feet, her logic 
relieved that 
> he was at least alright now...sort of.
> 
> But even as she watched, she knew that this was wrong and that she 
shouldn't 
> have hurt him. A ting if guilt in her spark.
> She faught her beast modes to attach him again, wanting to rip him 
apart. 
> But this time she resisted, using as much will power as she could 
handle.
> 
> As she heard Prowl ask a question she understood she began to shift 
her 
> weight uneasily, her systems far to ferel to communicate to him, 
but 
> systematic and logical enough to know what he was talking about.
> 
> Of course she wasn't all right! And she wanted to scream that at 
him, but 
> she didn't know how to form the sounds into the peoper words.
> Her systems were overloading from too much power, her adrnalin was 
through 
> the roof, she was trapped in this mode and didn't know how to get 
out.
> She wanted...no...NEEDED help, but she didn't know how to ask for 
it.
> 
> As the mode shifted she began to look towards Prowl nervously, 
almost like a 
> dog that knew it did something bad and was now facing its owner.
> But she began to slightly mew as well, pathetic little sounds that 
> communicated her uneasyness.
> 
> She wanted help, and this was the best way she knew how to ask for 
it.
> But at any moment she could become vilent again, and she wanted 
help to keep 
> those mood swings under control. But also to keep her beast modes 
under 
> controle as well.
> 
> The mode soon began to pace the room, almost seeming to want a way 
out like 
> she wanted a way out of this terror which was true.
> But the pacing was also doing something else as well, it was 
keeping her 
> beast modes under control...for now.*
> 
> 
>
